Package constants

This package contains a bunch of "constants" (read: global variables that shouldn't be modified during execution) that are used to configure the program in various ways. More...


Variables

string gameName = 'Jetblade RL'
 Name of the game, displayed as the title of the game window.
int globalId = 0
 For debugging purposes, any class that needs to have a unique ID should use this object and increment it when they're done.
int sw = 900
 Screen width.
int sh = 650
 Screen height.
int blockSize = 50
 The size of a single block of terrain in the map.
int EPSILON = 0001
 "Small number" used largely for checking equality of floating point numbers.
int DELTA = 1
 Slightly less-small number than EPSILON, used for checking Line coincidence in Map and Line modules.
int BIGNUM = 999988887777666655554444333322221111
 Large number to initialize minimum values to.
string mapPath = 'data/mapgen'
 Path to the custom map generation modules.
string imagePath = 'data/images'
 Path to image files and their configuration.
string soundPath = 'data/sound'
 Path to soundeffects.
string fontPath = 'data/fonts'
 Path to fonts.
string spriteFilename = 'spriteConfig'
 Name of the module used to configure animation data.
string fontFilename = 'fontConfig'
 Name of the module used to configure fonts.
tuple fpsDisplayLoc = Vector2D(sw - 20, sh - 20)
 Location to display the FPS string onscreen.
string ACTION_QUIT = 'quit'
int CONTEXT_GAME = 1
 In-game UI context, for UI elements and event handling.
int CONTEXT_MENU = 2
 Main menu UI context, for UI elements and event handling.

Detailed Description

This package contains a bunch of "constants" (read: global variables that shouldn't be modified during execution) that are used to configure the program in various ways.

Variable Documentation

int constants.BIGNUM = 999988887777666655554444333322221111

Large number to initialize minimum values to.

int constants.CONTEXT_GAME = 1

In-game UI context, for UI elements and event handling.

int constants.CONTEXT_MENU = 2

Main menu UI context, for UI elements and event handling.

int constants.DELTA = 1

Slightly less-small number than EPSILON, used for checking Line coincidence in Map and Line modules.

int constants.EPSILON = 0001

"Small number" used largely for checking equality of floating point numbers.

tuple constants.fpsDisplayLoc = Vector2D(sw - 20, sh - 20)

Location to display the FPS string onscreen.

string constants.gameName = 'Jetblade RL'

Name of the game, displayed as the title of the game window.

int constants.globalId = 0

For debugging purposes, any class that needs to have a unique ID should use this object and increment it when they're done.

So this is one that actually *isn't* constant.
